verses.roman:
evaṁ śuśrūṣitas tāta
bhagavān kaśyapaḥ striyā
prahasya parama-prīto
ditim āhābhinandya ca

synonyms: evam—thus; śuśrūṣitaḥ—being served; tāta—O dear one; bhagavān—the powerful; kaśyapaḥ—Kaśyapa; striyā—by the woman; prahasya—smiling; parama-prītaḥ—being very pleased; ditim—to Diti; āha—said; abhinandya—approving; ca—also.
translation: O my dear one, the most powerful sage Kaśyapa, being extremely pleased by the mild behavior of his wife Diti, smiled and spoke to her as follows.
